content.description: Climb 3 bolts up to a flake. Jam or layback the flake and place gear. Climb 2 more bolts to the anchor. Fun route that feels secure the whole way. A little gritty due to low traffic
content.location: Bolt line just left of Brokeback

content.description: Great sport climb on the southeast side of True Grit Tower. Face climbing, bolt protected, gets steep at the end.  Lowers with a 70 meter rope.
content.location: Southeast side of True Grit Tower - facing the upper trail head parking lot (sun).

climbs.name: Rat Writ
climbs.fa: Jeff Baldwin Tom Hore & Brian Cabe August 2006

content.description:
Starts out fun, then gives way to hard pulls on steep rock.

Steep arete to steep face with thin, crispy holds.

This didn't have to happen if General Sterling Price had been on task.
content.protection: Bolted sports climb.  8 or so lead bolts to two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Located just to the right of True Grit.

Rappel (or lower off) route.

content.description:
A nice, thin face climb on crispy edges.

Steep at the bottom to a break over with a thin pull.  Lower angle run to the anchor.

Well bolted.
content.protection: Bolted sports route.  6 lead bolts to two bolt anchor.
content.location: Located on the far right side of the West Face of the True Grit formation.  Would be the first route to the left (and around the corner) from the True Grit route.
